description:
Given a square binary matrix, find the length of the shortest path from the top-left cell to the destination  cell given as (x, y) moving only in up, down, left, right directions.
consider matrix as 0 indexed.
You must return -1 in case of no path.

### Input Format
```
N : Number of rows
M : Number of columns
A : (N x M) Square Binary Matrix
X : Destination row 
Y : Destination column
```

### Example 1 

### Input
```CPP
3 4
1 0 0 0 
1 1 0 1 
0 1 1 1
2 3
``` 

### Output 
```CPP 
5
``` 
#### Explanation:
we have to go from A[0][0] to A[2][3]. Minimun steps will be 5.



### Constraints:
```CPP
1 <= n,m <= 100
0 <= x < n
0 <= y < m
title: Shortest Path in Binary Matrix
